intro: Dipcadi montanum, commonly known as the mountain buttercup, is a flowering plant belonging to the Ranunculaceae family. It is characterized by its basal rosette of lanceolate, hairy leaves and produces yellow flowers with five petals. The plant is native to mountainous regions of Europe and is often found in alpine and subalpine habitats. It thrives in well-drained, acidic soils and is adapted to cold climates. Due to its delicate structure and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
